", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "sc": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "general": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "obc": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "st": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "female": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}, "widowed": {"gte": 6, "lte": 14}}, "tags": ["Free Education", "Labor Community", "Life Skill Education"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Atal Awasiya Vidyala Yojana. It is also known as AAVY. The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to provide free education to children of construction workers employed in the informal sector. Under this scheme, two children of registered workers between the ages of 6 and 16 receive free residential education in dedicated schools.


The UP Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is a scheme that provides free education to poor children of construction workers in Uttar Pradesh. The scheme is currently being implemented in 18 districts of the state. The goal of the scheme is to provide these children with the opportunity to succeed in life and improve their standard of living The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Uttar Pradesh. Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department, Uttar Pradesh.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Free education, accommodation, and meals
Medical facilities
Sports and recreational activities
Access to a nurturing environment that fosters personal growth

Eligibility criteria include: Children destitute during the Corona period, identified by the Women Welfare Department, Lucknow.
Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General) are eligible.
Orphan children and offspring of duly registered construction workers, who have completed at least 01 year (365 days) membership period of the board after registration.
A maximum of 02 children per registered worker can avail educational benefits. The application process is as follows: > How to get register and apply for the scheme


Applicant must visit the below offices

  Nearest labor office.
  Tehsildar of the concerned tehsil.
  Block Development Officer of the concerned development block.

Get the application form and fill out the completely.
Attach required documents in the prescribed format.
Submit the application form in the same office. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.upbocw.in/pdf/adhisuchna/atal_awasiya_vidyalaya_scheme_100423.pdf Details: https://www.upbocw.in/StaticPages/schemes.aspx#tab3 Labor Department: https://www.upbocw.in/ Tags associated with the scheme include: Free Education, Labor Community, Life Skill Education.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Atal Awasiya Vidyala Yojana.
It is also known as AAVY.
The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to provide free education to children of construction workers employed in the informal sector.
Under this scheme, two children of registered workers between the ages of 6 and 16 receive free residential education in dedicated schools.
The UP Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is a scheme that provides free education to poor children of construction workers in Uttar Pradesh.
The scheme is currently being implemented in 18 districts of the state.
The goal of the scheme is to provide these children with the opportunity to succeed in life and improve their standard of living The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Uttar Pradesh.
Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department, Uttar Pradesh.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Free education, accommodation, and meals Medical facilities Sports and recreational activities Access to a nurturing environment that fosters personal growth Eligibility criteria include: Children destitute during the Corona period, identified by the Women Welfare Department, Lucknow.
Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General) are eligible.
Orphan children and offspring of duly registered construction workers, who have completed at least 01 year (365 days) membership period of the board after registration.
A maximum of 02 children per registered worker can avail educational benefits.
The application process is as follows: > How to get register and apply for the scheme Applicant must visit the below offices Nearest labor office.
Tehsildar of the concerned tehsil.
Block Development Officer of the concerned development block.
Get the application form and fill out the completely.
Attach required documents in the prescribed format.
Submit the application form in the same office.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
upbocw.
in/pdf/adhisuchna/atal_awasiya_vidyalaya_scheme_100423.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Atal Awasiya Vidyala Yojana. It is also known as AAVY. The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to provide free education to children of construction workers employed in the informal sector. Under this scheme, two children of registered workers between the ages of 6 and 16 receive free residential education in dedicated schools.

The UP Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is a scheme that provides free education to poor children of construction workers in Uttar Pradesh. The scheme is currently being implemented in 18 districts of the state. The goal of the scheme is to provide these children with the opportunity to succeed in life and improve their standard of living The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Uttar Pradesh.

Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department, Uttar Pradesh. The scheme provides the following benefits: Free education, accommodation, and meals Medical facilities Sports and recreational activities Access to a nurturing environment that fosters personal growth Eligibility criteria include: Children destitute during the Corona period, identified by the Women Welfare Department, Lucknow. Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General) are eligible. Orphan children and offspring of duly registered construction workers, who have completed at least 01 year (365 days) membership period of the board after registration.

A maximum of 02 children per registered worker can avail educational benefits. The application process is as follows: > How to get register and apply for the scheme Applicant must visit the below offices Nearest labor office. Tehsildar of the concerned tehsil. Block Development Officer of the concerned development block.

Get the application form and fill out the completely. Attach required documents in the prescribed format. Submit the application form in the same office. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
upbocw. in/pdf/adhisuchna/atal_awasiya_vidyalaya_scheme_100423. pdf Details: https://www. upbocw.
in/StaticPages/schemes. aspx#tab3 Labor Department: https://www. upbocw. in/ Tags associated with the scheme include: Free Education, Labor Community, Life Skill Education.

prompts.image_prompt: Flat-icon infographic, pastel palette – Poster 1/1 – Benefits. Before and after comparison showing impact of The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to provide free education to children of construc…
prompts.caption: Benefits: The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the
prompts.ctu_text: The name of this welfare scheme is Atal Awasiya Vidyala Yojana. It is also known as AAVY. The Atal Awasiya Vidyalaya Yojana is an initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to provide free education to children of construction workers employed in the informal sector. Under this scheme, two children of registered workers between the ages of 6 and 16 receive free residential education in dedicated schools.

prompts.image_prompt: Flat-icon infographic, pastel palette – Poster 1/1 – Eligibility. Checklist showing Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General) are eligible requirements in simple visual format
prompts.caption: Requirements: Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General)…
prompts.ctu_text: Additionally, the nodal department is Labour Department, Uttar Pradesh. The scheme provides the following benefits: Free education, accommodation, and meals Medical facilities Sports and recreational activities Access to a nurturing environment that fosters personal growth Eligibility criteria include: Children destitute during the Corona period, identified by the Women Welfare Department, Lucknow. Children for the Chief Minister Child Service Scheme (General) are eligible. Orphan children and offspring of duly registered construction workers, who have completed at least 01 year (365 days) membership period of the board after registration.

prompts.ctu_text: Get the application form and fill out the completely. Attach required documents in the prescribed format. Submit the application form in the same office. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.

prompts.caption: Contact: get help
prompts.ctu_text:
Applicant must visit the below offices

 - Nearest labor office. 
 - Tehsildar of the concerned tehsil. 
 - Block Development Officer of the concerned development block.
